Are you passionate about data analysis? Do you consider yourself a team player and detailed-oriented person? Would you like to be part of a data driven team? If so, this could be your opportunity.

As Data Analyst and as a part of our Digital Customer Team, you'll be responsible for ensure data quality and data flow across the entire marketing tech ecosystem, with special focus on the use of all our Marketing Stack Technology, including CDP (Tealium), Tag Managment, Marketing Automation (Salesforce), CRM (Salesforce), Google Analytics and the likes.

We are looking for:

Education background: Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, IT Engineering or equivalent degree with a solid technical & analytical background.

Some background in ETL Processes (Data extraction, treatment).
Some form of Knowledge and use of DataBases (SQL, PL-SQL, SAS).

Some form of knowledge on visualization and data analysis technologies on cloud like Google BigQuery.
Excellent written and verbal communication; extremely proficient in presentation writing tools (e.g., PowerPoint, Slides).
Analytical, passionate about numbers, organized and highly detail-oriented.
Strong business orientation and development drive; able to provide insights.
Team player, reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of executing on multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment working with cross functional teams.
The ability to work with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty, ambiguity, and the challenge of quickly evolving goals.
Be an ambassador of agile methodology workflow across the company.
Proven experience in statistical analysis will be highly valued.

We offer you:

Dynamic and challenging environment.
Home office hybrid model.
Work-life balance policies.
Training programs.
Benefits and discounts in the Group products.
Flexible compensation program.

WPP is the transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients, and communities.

Working at WPP means being part of a global network of more than 109,000 accomplished people in 110 countries. WPP has headquarters in New York, London and Singapore and a corporate presence in major markets worldwide.

We create transformative ideas and outcomes for our clients through an integrated offer of communications, experience, commerce, and technology.

WPP and our award-winning agencies work with most of the world's biggest companies and organisations ‚Äì from Ford, Unilever and P&G to Google, HSBC, and the UN. Our clients include 61 of the FTSE 100, 317 of the Fortune Global 500, all 30 of the Dow Jones 30 and 62 of the NASDAQ 100. WPP are the leader in the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index and 8th in the FTSE 100 rankings for Women on Boards.

Why we're hiring:

We are looking to hire a Data Analyst based in Madrid.

Identify and interpret trends/patterns in large datasets

What you'll need:

Strong analytical, quantitative and problem-solving skills
Willingness to learn new tools and systems
Technology experience or interest
Good attention to detail

Who you are:

You're open : We are inclusive and collaborative; we encourage the free exchange of ideas; we respect and celebrate diverse views. We are accepting: of new ideas, new partnerships, new ways of working.

You're optimistic : We believe in the power of creativity, technology and talent to create brighter futures or our people, our clients and our communities. We approach all that we do with conviction: to try the new and to seek the unexpected.

You're extraordinary: we are stronger together: through collaboration we achieve the amazing. We are creative leaders and pioneers of our industry; we provide extraordinary every day.

What we'll give you:

Passionate, inspired people ‚Äì We promote a culture of people that do extraordinary work.

Scale and opportunity ‚Äì We offer the opportunity to create, influence and complete projects at a scale that is unparalleled in the industry.

Challenging and stimulating work ‚Äì Unique work and the opportunity to join a group of creative problem solvers. Are you up for the challenge?

WPP is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability. description:
Acerca del empleo
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions

What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge

Nice to have
Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++‚Ä¶)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Acerca del empleo
Do you want to be part of a leading international company in offering solutions to the hospitality industry?

MAKRO (it is a subsidiary of the METRO Group), whose objective is to bring distribution within the HoReCa sector to its maximum level, taking advantage of the advantages offered by digitalization or the delivery service, always maintaining the focus on the client and success of your business.

We are looking for a BI Analyst (Operations) for the new area of Data & Analytics, whose main mission is to be a part of driving force of business performance and business insights at Makro Spain that can lead to impactful decisions through the data :

-Work with BI and Operations team to Harmonize / rationalize the company extensive data Operations pipelines (ELT process) to maximize the data model and optimize the delivery of the reporting layer.
-Work together with Operations (Sales & Store workforce) in the definition and design of the Operation 360¬∫ reporting.
-Design of KPIs and Dashboards to help the area in decision making (activation): salesforce goals, sales tracking, store Kpis.
-Work with stakeholders including the Managers and business users to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data solution needs.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

‚Ä¢You will contribute with your knowledge and experience to improve and increase the company‚Äôs operations knowledge. The final goal is to set up, evolve and maintain platform data pipelines so the Sales department can be independent to understand and handle their own insights.
‚Ä¢Support the Operations area in the implementation of a consistent reporting flow (through MicroStrategy) with relevant information for the department's decision-making.

‚Ä¢Being used to handling information for the construction of KPIs related to the domain of operations such as: Cac, Number of sales, Customer acquisition rate, Stable customer rate, Lost customers, Acquired customers, Average ticket per customer‚Ä¶etc

‚Ä¢Being used to salesforce business processes (recruitment, growth, retention/loyalty, reactivation).

‚Ä¢Have experience in the creation of datamarts and work with large volumes of data for the generation of optimal reporting.

‚Ä¢Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
EXPERIENCE AND CAPABILITIES

‚Ä¢Undergraduate degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Programming or a technical career
‚Ä¢3-7 years in similar positions‚Äì ideally retail company
‚Ä¢Excellent data modeling and querying capacity in Google Big Query, Oracle, Sqlserver‚Ä¶etc)
‚Ä¢Valuable knowledge in our Data visualization tool as MicroStrategy and Qlink)
‚Ä¢Experience with scripting languages: Python or R at least
‚Ä¢Valuable knowledge in our Etl tool as Talend (valuable knowledge of cloud versions).

COMPETENCY

‚Ä¢Ability to work on multiple projects independently
‚Ä¢Teamplayer with analyst and business profiles
‚Ä¢Attention to detail and continuous improvement
‚Ä¢Service leadership
‚Ä¢Resourcefulnes and resilience

OUR PROPOSAL

- We offer you to be part of a global company, leader in wholesale distribution and that seeks to continuously contribute to the culture and social life of the more than 30 countries in which we are present.

- Our proposal is based on a competitive salary, benefits designed for you and the possibility of opting for our flexible remuneration plan.

- At Makro, you are in charge of your own development. So that your growth has no limits, we offer you a proactive and open training platform.

- Your well-being and work-life balance are important to us. That's why we offer you an annual flexible work plan and an intensive summer working day.

OUR TEAM

At Makro we are committed to Equal Opportunities for women and men and we are committed to guaranteeing this in the selection processes we carry out.

If you are a positive, enterprising person and want to work with a leading team to build a project for the future and be the partner of the hospitality industry, we are looking for people like YOU!

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions

What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge

Nice to have
Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++‚Ä¶)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Acerca del empleo
Do you want to be part of a leading international company in offering solutions to the hospitality industry?

MAKRO (it is a subsidiary of the METRO Group), whose objective is to bring distribution within the HoReCa sector to its maximum level, taking advantage of the advantages offered by digitalization or the delivery service, always maintaining the focus on the client and success of your business.

We are looking for a BI Analyst (Operations) for the new area of Data & Analytics, whose main mission is to be a part of driving force of business performance and business insights at Makro Spain that can lead to impactful decisions through the data :

-Work with BI and Operations team to Harmonize / rationalize the company extensive data Operations pipelines (ELT process) to maximize the data model and optimize the delivery of the reporting layer.
-Work together with Operations (Sales & Store workforce) in the definition and design of the Operation 360¬∫ reporting.
-Design of KPIs and Dashboards to help the area in decision making (activation): salesforce goals, sales tracking, store Kpis.
-Work with stakeholders including the Managers and business users to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data solution needs.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

‚Ä¢You will contribute with your knowledge and experience to improve and increase the company‚Äôs operations knowledge. The final goal is to set up, evolve and maintain platform data pipelines so the Sales department can be independent to understand and handle their own insights.
‚Ä¢Support the Operations area in the implementation of a consistent reporting flow (through MicroStrategy) with relevant information for the department's decision-making.

‚Ä¢Being used to handling information for the construction of KPIs related to the domain of operations such as: Cac, Number of sales, Customer acquisition rate, Stable customer rate, Lost customers, Acquired customers, Average ticket per customer‚Ä¶etc

‚Ä¢Being used to salesforce business processes (recruitment, growth, retention/loyalty, reactivation).

‚Ä¢Have experience in the creation of datamarts and work with large volumes of data for the generation of optimal reporting.

‚Ä¢Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
EXPERIENCE AND CAPABILITIES

‚Ä¢Undergraduate degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Programming or a technical career
‚Ä¢3-7 years in similar positions‚Äì ideally retail company
‚Ä¢Excellent data modeling and querying capacity in Google Big Query, Oracle, Sqlserver‚Ä¶etc)
‚Ä¢Valuable knowledge in our Data visualization tool as MicroStrategy and Qlink)
‚Ä¢Experience with scripting languages: Python or R at least
‚Ä¢Valuable knowledge in our Etl tool as Talend (valuable knowledge of cloud versions).

COMPETENCY

‚Ä¢Ability to work on multiple projects independently
‚Ä¢Teamplayer with analyst and business profiles
‚Ä¢Attention to detail and continuous improvement
‚Ä¢Service leadership
‚Ä¢Resourcefulnes and resilience

OUR PROPOSAL

- We offer you to be part of a global company, leader in wholesale distribution and that seeks to continuously contribute to the culture and social life of the more than 30 countries in which we are present.

- Our proposal is based on a competitive salary, benefits designed for you and the possibility of opting for our flexible remuneration plan.

- At Makro, you are in charge of your own development. So that your growth has no limits, we offer you a proactive and open training platform.

- Your well-being and work-life balance are important to us. That's why we offer you an annual flexible work plan and an intensive summer working day.

OUR TEAM

At Makro we are committed to Equal Opportunities for women and men and we are committed to guaranteeing this in the selection processes we carry out.

If you are a positive, enterprising person and want to work with a leading team to build a project for the future and be the partner of the hospitality industry, we are looking for people like YOU!

description:
Acerca del empleo
Something Extraordinary Every Day‚Ñ¢
As our Customer Knowledge and Insights Analyst, you support our membership and Private Client Services programme, by providing data-driven insights to relevant senior executives leading those business units. You will be responsible for commercial modelling of the programmes, KPI forecasting, reporting and deep analytics, all of which will enable key leaders to make informed decisions on strategy and progress against key targets.

We are looking for someone to support us with deep data analytics & guest insights in order for us to create convincing evidence for brands, Villages and growth initiatives. You will also be segmenting the guest database in new ways to inform business decisions and more effective marketing.

You will apply strategic thinking to translate guest insights into defined business opportunities which help drive guest value and loyalty across our Membership and Private Client Services Programmes.

What makes you special
Every colleague is an entrepreneur at heart and this drives our organisational culture, which values invention, innovation and risk taking. To be successful with us as our Customer Knowledge and Insights Analyst you‚Äôll have/be:

Experience in advanced analytics, customer insights, strategy, management consulting, investment banking or equivalent
Working knowledge of SQL, Python, Power BI, Power BI DAX, R statistical software, Excel and Salesforce.
The ability to extract and manipulate data from CRM systems to other tools
Examples of when you‚Äôve structured large analytical problems, simplified and analysed them
Detailed understanding of guest intelligence and impact it has on business strategy
Fluency in English (verbal and written); any other European languages would be advantageous
Highly analytical and detail conscious

There‚Äôs no one quite like us
The Bicester Village Shopping Collection are the worlds‚Äô leading luxury shopping destinations, and we are committed to creating magical and memorable experiences for our guests. Taking the name of the founding Village, The Bicester Village Shopping Collection distinguishes the 11 Villages in Europe and China as one collection of destinations for our guests, our brand partners, our travel and tourism partners, our corporate and financial media, and our internal teams.
Why we‚Äôre exceptional
The key to our success is the quality and commitment of our people. To work in one of the teams at any of the Villages is to play an active role in redefining both the art and the science of retail. This creates a dynamic approach that underpins our ability to anticipate future trends in a fast changing world. In return for your Authenticity, Critical Thinking, Innovation, Passion and Vision, you‚Äôll receive a generous salary and we‚Äôll also reward you by:

Looking after you: You‚Äôre entitled to 25 days of annual leave (plus UK Bank Holidays) and your birthday off, plus extra leave if you are getting married or moving. We provide above industry average life assurance cover, income protection, pension, personal travel insurance, dental and eyecare, private healthcare, access to a virtual GP app, Employee Assistance Programme, cycle to work scheme and flu vaccinations

Treating you: discounts throughout our villages, discounts with other retailers (known as My Choices) and a very generous employee referral bonus

Championing you: you‚Äôll be working within a creative and collaborative environment like no other, with the opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills while advancing your career.

Come and live your story with us
The Bicester Village Shopping Collection is made up of 1,200 colleagues of 50 nationalities. We are diverse in background, age, experience and leadership style. We believe that an inclusive workforce makes magic happen, and with this in mind we welcome everyone - regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability or ethnicity - to be a part of our family.

You got it?
We like you!

Acerca del empleo
Power BI Data Modelling Analyst
Spain, Hybrid way of working

Would you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project with a true impact? Do you enjoy working on projects that combine data and business intelligence? Are you a storyteller, familiar with the use of data and interactive visuals to translate patterns and insights into creative business reports? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!

You will be responsible for the modeling and consumption of Data using MySQL and/or Oracle.
You will collaborate on the creation of data models in Power BI, cooperating with the data engineers of the data virtualization layer to establish a consistent data flow end-to-end.
You will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of data flows using Power Query and M language in Power BI.
You will interact with the customer to get the functional requirements and translate them into technical ones.
You will be responsible for the maintenance of the data models in Power BI following best practices and standards across the industry.
You will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of reports and dashboards in Power BI, including design, implementation, testing, security level, and data modeling.
You will interact with the stakeholders for detecting and solving issues or needs related to the platform.

What is in it for you?

When you join our team, we offer you a competitive salary and secondary benefits. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work Certification 2021-2022: https://www.fujitsu.com/es/about/great-place/

Your profile

You have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Telecommunications or Computer Engineering, and at least 3 years of experience with Power BI, preferably within the IT and/or consultancy industry and working on projects related to data and data warehouse in Microsoft Technologies, so the Power BI Portal holds no secrets for you, making you familiar with:

Configuration and maintenance of the connection gates (professional and personal) of Microsoft Power BI and administration of licenses, users, and workspaces.
You manage the functionalities of Power BI and the allowed codes, including the use of SQL.
You have experience with the creation of ETL Workflows by Power Query with a graphical interface and M language in Power BI.
You have experience with the application of relations and hierarchies in Power BI for the materialization of detailed models.
You have knowledge of DAX Language and experience in the creation of Power BI measurements, columns, and data transformations.
You know how to model, cleanse, and ensure the quality of data, keeping control of missing data, mistakes, inconsistencies, or inadequacy.
You have participated in the designing of models for analytical data exploitation according to the functional requirements. All of it while following good corporate practices, and adapting to different levels of normalization, preferably in the STAR model without ambiguity or redundancies.
Experience working with agile, Kanban, scrum boards, and project manager.

You were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results. You are a natural team player, eager to learn, and flexible to adapt regardless of the environments you are required to join. Next to this, you are fluent in Spanish and English.

Shape your world and achieve together

We want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.

About Fujitsu

Since being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.

More information: www.fujitsu.com.

Acerca del empleo
CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world‚Äôs biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.

What does that mean for you? You‚Äôll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You‚Äôll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You‚Äôll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model.

Job Description

As an Implementation Specialist/Analyst, you will help to deliver Digital asset tracking solutions globally to Brambles customers as the company widens its digital footprint, gathers key learnings, and further develops its tech capability and value proposition for customer solutions.
You will be someone who has analytical and software application background, decent knowledge about industrial and retail supply chain network, and rich experience in working with R&D team on deploying new solutions still in development, and project management from technical implementation perspective. The role would be dedicated to Digital customer solution projects.

Key Accountabilities
Digital Solution Delivery ‚Äì Partner with customer solution product owners and customer users to understand detail business requirements, provide mapping requirements and solutions, provide assistance for implementations and analysis, conduct system setup and customized configurations, document results of applications, review and evaluate technical issues and processes.

Digital Solution Readiness and Scalability ‚Äì Work closely with Digital software/hardware engineering team, product, support and operations team to understand gaps from end to end solution perspective. Assist operations team design processes to ensure data capture aligns with configuration, system computation and eventual result for customers; Provide workarounds on existing gaps and feedback on future product/feature development; First level troubleshooting on initial deployment and hyper care stage to ensure responsiveness and alignment with general solution support team; Design deployment, adjust and prioritize accordingly based on engineering team‚Äôs development plans and commercial value proposition.

Customer Engagement & Satisfaction ‚Äì Serve as major interface and liaison with customer users from technical implementation perspective throughout the solution delivery and post mortem session. Work closely with commercial and product team hearing customer feedback in iterative staged development and deployment cycles.

Project Management ‚Äì Manage projects from solution implementation perspective and liaison with engineering and product team on potential workarounds or testing required such as from compliance, legal and security considerations.

Customer Service - On-board user training and support from analytical perspective
User Acceptance Testing ‚Äì Participate in house user acceptance testing to ensure the end to end solution is reliable and repeatable on all user cases.

Zero Harm ‚Äì Ensure all operations are compliance with Zero Harm framework with all Zero Harm policies and action plans are fully implemented.

Experience and Skills

3+ year experience of software solution delivery and implementation
Rich project leadership and project management experience
Business cases/projects managed and executed with customers
Knowledge of industrial supply chain network is strongly preferred
Knowledge in IoT digital solution is strongly preferred
Cross functional experience and effective communication
Working experience in a global and diversed cultural organization
Experience providing data analytics
Understanding of databases structure

Technical Skills: exposure to Python, Excel, Hive SQL, SQL, Pyspark, Reporting tools & Visualization tools. Cloud Platforms: ideally AWS

Personal: energetic, proactive, effective communicator, solution driven, customer focused, independent, self-disciplined, hands-on, analytical, result oriented, relationship builder, team leader, team player, strategic & critical thinker, quick learner, collaborative.

Preferred Education
Bachelors

Preferred Level of Work Experience
3 - 5 years

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to developing a diverse workforce in which everyone is treated fairly, with respect, and has the opportunity to contribute to business success while realizing his or her potential. This means harnessing the unique skills and experience that each individual brings and we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

Individuals fraudulently misrepresenting themselves as Brambles or CHEP representatives have scheduled interviews and offered fraudulent employment opportunities with the intent to commit identity theft or solicit money. Brambles and CHEP never conduct interviews via online chat or request money as a term of employment. If you have a question as to the legitimacy of an interview or job offer, please contact us at recruitment@brambles.com.

Acerca del empleo
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying

What You'll Need

Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge

Nice to have
Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++‚Ä¶)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Acerca del empleo
Something Extraordinary Every Day‚Ñ¢
As our Customer Knowledge and Insights Analyst, you support our membership and Private Client Services programme, by providing data-driven insights to relevant senior executives leading those business units. You will be responsible for commercial modelling of the programmes, KPI forecasting, reporting and deep analytics, all of which will enable key leaders to make informed decisions on strategy and progress against key targets.

We are looking for someone to support us with deep data analytics & guest insights in order for us to create convincing evidence for brands, Villages and growth initiatives. You will also be segmenting the guest database in new ways to inform business decisions and more effective marketing.

You will apply strategic thinking to translate guest insights into defined business opportunities which help drive guest value and loyalty across our Membership and Private Client Services Programmes.

What makes you special
Every colleague is an entrepreneur at heart and this drives our organisational culture, which values invention, innovation and risk taking. To be successful with us as our Customer Knowledge and Insights Analyst you‚Äôll have/be:

Experience in advanced analytics, customer insights, strategy, management consulting, investment banking or equivalent
Working knowledge of SQL, Python, Power BI, Power BI DAX, R statistical software, Excel and Salesforce.
The ability to extract and manipulate data from CRM systems to other tools
Examples of when you‚Äôve structured large analytical problems, simplified and analysed them
Detailed understanding of guest intelligence and impact it has on business strategy
Fluency in English (verbal and written); any other European languages would be advantageous
Highly analytical and detail conscious

There‚Äôs no one quite like us
The Bicester Village Shopping Collection are the worlds‚Äô leading luxury shopping destinations, and we are committed to creating magical and memorable experiences for our guests. Taking the name of the founding Village, The Bicester Village Shopping Collection distinguishes the 11 Villages in Europe and China as one collection of destinations for our guests, our brand partners, our travel and tourism partners, our corporate and financial media, and our internal teams.
Why we‚Äôre exceptional
The key to our success is the quality and commitment of our people. To work in one of the teams at any of the Villages is to play an active role in redefining both the art and the science of retail. This creates a dynamic approach that underpins our ability to anticipate future trends in a fast changing world. In return for your Authenticity, Critical Thinking, Innovation, Passion and Vision, you‚Äôll receive a generous salary and we‚Äôll also reward you by:

Looking after you: You‚Äôre entitled to 25 days of annual leave (plus UK Bank Holidays) and your birthday off, plus extra leave if you are getting married or moving. We provide above industry average life assurance cover, income protection, pension, personal travel insurance, dental and eyecare, private healthcare, access to a virtual GP app, Employee Assistance Programme, cycle to work scheme and flu vaccinations

Treating you: discounts throughout our villages, discounts with other retailers (known as My Choices) and a very generous employee referral bonus

Championing you: you‚Äôll be working within a creative and collaborative environment like no other, with the opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills while advancing your career.

Come and live your story with us
The Bicester Village Shopping Collection is made up of 1,200 colleagues of 50 nationalities. We are diverse in background, age, experience and leadership style. We believe that an inclusive workforce makes magic happen, and with this in mind we welcome everyone - regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability or ethnicity - to be a part of our family.

You got it?
We like you!

Acerca del empleo
Power BI Data Modelling Analyst
Spain, Hybrid way of working

Would you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project with a true impact? Do you enjoy working on projects that combine data and business intelligence? Are you a storyteller, familiar with the use of data and interactive visuals to translate patterns and insights into creative business reports? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!

You will be responsible for the modeling and consumption of Data using MySQL and/or Oracle.
You will collaborate on the creation of data models in Power BI, cooperating with the data engineers of the data virtualization layer to establish a consistent data flow end-to-end.
You will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of data flows using Power Query and M language in Power BI.
You will interact with the customer to get the functional requirements and translate them into technical ones.
You will be responsible for the maintenance of the data models in Power BI following best practices and standards across the industry.
You will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of reports and dashboards in Power BI, including design, implementation, testing, security level, and data modeling.
You will interact with the stakeholders for detecting and solving issues or needs related to the platform.

What is in it for you?

When you join our team, we offer you a competitive salary and secondary benefits. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work Certification 2021-2022: https://www.fujitsu.com/es/about/great-place/

Your profile

You have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Telecommunications or Computer Engineering, and at least 3 years of experience with Power BI, preferably within the IT and/or consultancy industry and working on projects related to data and data warehouse in Microsoft Technologies, so the Power BI Portal holds no secrets for you, making you familiar with:

Configuration and maintenance of the connection gates (professional and personal) of Microsoft Power BI and administration of licenses, users, and workspaces.
You manage the functionalities of Power BI and the allowed codes, including the use of SQL.
You have experience with the creation of ETL Workflows by Power Query with a graphical interface and M language in Power BI.
You have experience with the application of relations and hierarchies in Power BI for the materialization of detailed models.
You have knowledge of DAX Language and experience in the creation of Power BI measurements, columns, and data transformations.
You know how to model, cleanse, and ensure the quality of data, keeping control of missing data, mistakes, inconsistencies, or inadequacy.
You have participated in the designing of models for analytical data exploitation according to the functional requirements. All of it while following good corporate practices, and adapting to different levels of normalization, preferably in the STAR model without ambiguity or redundancies.
Experience working with agile, Kanban, scrum boards, and project manager.

You were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results. You are a natural team player, eager to learn, and flexible to adapt regardless of the environments you are required to join. Next to this, you are fluent in Spanish and English.

Shape your world and achieve together

We want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.

About Fujitsu

Since being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.

More information: www.fujitsu.com.

Acerca del empleo
CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world‚Äôs biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.

What does that mean for you? You‚Äôll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You‚Äôll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You‚Äôll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model.

Job Description

As an Implementation Specialist/Analyst, you will help to deliver Digital asset tracking solutions globally to Brambles customers as the company widens its digital footprint, gathers key learnings, and further develops its tech capability and value proposition for customer solutions.
You will be someone who has analytical and software application background, decent knowledge about industrial and retail supply chain network, and rich experience in working with R&D team on deploying new solutions still in development, and project management from technical implementation perspective. The role would be dedicated to Digital customer solution projects.

Key Accountabilities
Digital Solution Delivery ‚Äì Partner with customer solution product owners and customer users to understand detail business requirements, provide mapping requirements and solutions, provide assistance for implementations and analysis, conduct system setup and customized configurations, document results of applications, review and evaluate technical issues and processes.

Digital Solution Readiness and Scalability ‚Äì Work closely with Digital software/hardware engineering team, product, support and operations team to understand gaps from end to end solution perspective. Assist operations team design processes to ensure data capture aligns with configuration, system computation and eventual result for customers; Provide workarounds on existing gaps and feedback on future product/feature development; First level troubleshooting on initial deployment and hyper care stage to ensure responsiveness and alignment with general solution support team; Design deployment, adjust and prioritize accordingly based on engineering team‚Äôs development plans and commercial value proposition.

Customer Engagement & Satisfaction ‚Äì Serve as major interface and liaison with customer users from technical implementation perspective throughout the solution delivery and post mortem session. Work closely with commercial and product team hearing customer feedback in iterative staged development and deployment cycles.

WPP is the transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients, and communities.

Working at WPP means being part of a global network of more than 109,000 accomplished people in 110 countries. WPP has headquarters in New York, London and Singapore and a corporate presence in major markets worldwide.

Challenging and stimulating work ‚Äì Unique work and the opportunity to join a group of creative problem solvers. Are you up for the challenge?

Acerca del empleo
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions

What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge

Nice to have
Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++‚Ä¶)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Acerca del empleo
Do you want to be part of a leading international company in offering solutions to the hospitality industry?

MAKRO (it is a subsidiary of the METRO Group), whose objective is to bring distribution within the HoReCa sector to its maximum level, taking advantage of the advantages offered by digitalization or the delivery service, always maintaining the focus on the client and success of your business.

We are looking for a BI Analyst (Operations) for the new area of Data & Analytics, whose main mission is to be a part of driving force of business performance and business insights at Makro Spain that can lead to impactful decisions through the data :

-Work with BI and Operations team to Harmonize / rationalize the company extensive data Operations pipelines (ELT process) to maximize the data model and optimize the delivery of the reporting layer.
-Work together with Operations (Sales & Store workforce) in the definition and design of the Operation 360¬∫ reporting.
-Design of KPIs and Dashboards to help the area in decision making (activation): salesforce goals, sales tracking, store Kpis.
-Work with stakeholders including the Managers and business users to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data solution needs.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

‚Ä¢You will contribute with your knowledge and experience to improve and increase the company‚Äôs operations knowledge. The final goal is to set up, evolve and maintain platform data pipelines so the Sales department can be independent to understand and handle their own insights.
‚Ä¢Support the Operations area in the implementation of a consistent reporting flow (through MicroStrategy) with relevant information for the department's decision-making.

‚Ä¢Being used to handling information for the construction of KPIs related to the domain of operations such as: Cac, Number of sales, Customer acquisition rate, Stable customer rate, Lost customers, Acquired customers, Average ticket per customer‚Ä¶etc

‚Ä¢Being used to salesforce business processes (recruitment, growth, retention/loyalty, reactivation).

‚Ä¢Have experience in the creation of datamarts and work with large volumes of data for the generation of optimal reporting.

‚Ä¢Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
EXPERIENCE AND CAPABILITIES

‚Ä¢Undergraduate degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Programming or a technical career
‚Ä¢3-7 years in similar positions‚Äì ideally retail company
‚Ä¢Excellent data modeling and querying capacity in Google Big Query, Oracle, Sqlserver‚Ä¶etc)
‚Ä¢Valuable knowledge in our Data visualization tool as MicroStrategy and Qlink)
‚Ä¢Experience with scripting languages: Python or R at least
‚Ä¢Valuable knowledge in our Etl tool as Talend (valuable knowledge of cloud versions).

COMPETENCY

‚Ä¢Ability to work on multiple projects independently
‚Ä¢Teamplayer with analyst and business profiles
‚Ä¢Attention to detail and continuous improvement
‚Ä¢Service leadership
‚Ä¢Resourcefulnes and resilience

OUR PROPOSAL

- We offer you to be part of a global company, leader in wholesale distribution and that seeks to continuously contribute to the culture and social life of the more than 30 countries in which we are present.

- Our proposal is based on a competitive salary, benefits designed for you and the possibility of opting for our flexible remuneration plan.

- At Makro, you are in charge of your own development. So that your growth has no limits, we offer you a proactive and open training platform.

- Your well-being and work-life balance are important to us. That's why we offer you an annual flexible work plan and an intensive summer working day.

OUR TEAM

At Makro we are committed to Equal Opportunities for women and men and we are committed to guaranteeing this in the selection processes we carry out.

If you are a positive, enterprising person and want to work with a leading team to build a project for the future and be the partner of the hospitality industry, we are looking for people like YOU!

You will be responsible for commercial modelling of the programmes, KPI forecasting, reporting and deep analytics, all of which will enable key leaders to make informed decisions on strategy and progress against key targets.

We are looking for someone to support us with deep data analytics & guest insights in order for us to create convincing evidence for brands, Villages and growth initiatives. You will also be segmenting the guest database in new ways to inform business decisions and more effective marketing.

You will apply strategic thinking to translate guest insights into defined business opportunities which help drive guest value and loyalty across our Membership and Private Client Services Programmes.

What makes you special
Every colleague is an entrepreneur at heart and this drives our organisational culture, which values invention, innovation and risk taking. To be successful with us as our Customer Knowledge and Insights Analyst you‚Äôll have/be:

Experience in advanced analytics, customer insights, strategy, management consulting, investment banking or equivalent
Working knowledge of SQL, Python, Power BI, Power BI DAX, R statistical software, Excel and Salesforce.
The ability to extract and manipulate data from CRM systems to other tools
Examples of when you‚Äôve structured large analytical problems, simplified and analysed them
Detailed understanding of guest intelligence and impact it has on business strategy
Fluency in English (verbal and written); any other European languages would be advantageous
Highly analytical and detail conscious

There‚Äôs no one quite like us
The Bicester Village Shopping Collection are the worlds‚Äô leading luxury shopping destinations, and we are committed to creating magical and memorable experiences for our guests. Taking the name of the founding Village, The Bicester Village Shopping Collection distinguishes the 11 Villages in Europe and China as one collection of destinations for our guests, our brand partners, our travel and tourism partners, our corporate and financial media, and our internal teams.
Why we‚Äôre exceptional
The key to our success is the quality and commitment of our people. To work in one of the teams at any of the Villages is to play an active role in redefining both the art and the science of retail. This creates a dynamic approach that underpins our ability to anticipate future trends in a fast changing world. In return for your Authenticity, Critical Thinking, Innovation, Passion and Vision, you‚Äôll receive a generous salary and we‚Äôll also reward you by:

Looking after you: You‚Äôre entitled to 25 days of annual leave (plus UK Bank Holidays) and your birthday off, plus extra leave if you are getting married or moving. We provide above industry average life assurance cover, income protection, pension, personal travel insurance, dental and eyecare, private healthcare, access to a virtual GP app, Employee Assistance Programme, cycle to work scheme and flu vaccinations

Treating you: discounts throughout our villages, discounts with other retailers (known as My Choices) and a very generous employee referral bonus

Championing you: you‚Äôll be working within a creative and collaborative environment like no other, with the opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills while advancing your career.

Come and live your story with us
The Bicester Village Shopping Collection is made up of 1,200 colleagues of 50 nationalities. We are diverse in background, age, experience and leadership style. We believe that an inclusive workforce makes magic happen, and with this in mind we welcome everyone - regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability or ethnicity - to be a part of our family.

You got it?
We like you!

Acerca del empleo
Power BI Data Modelling Analyst
Spain, Hybrid way of working

Would you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project with a true impact? Do you enjoy working on projects that combine data and business intelligence? Are you a storyteller, familiar with the use of data and interactive visuals to translate patterns and insights into creative business reports? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!

You will be responsible for the modeling and consumption of Data using MySQL and/or Oracle.
You will collaborate on the creation of data models in Power BI, cooperating with the data engineers of the data virtualization layer to establish a consistent data flow end-to-end.
You will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of data flows using Power Query and M language in Power BI.
You will interact with the customer to get the functional requirements and translate them into technical ones.
You will be responsible for the maintenance of the data models in Power BI following best practices and standards across the industry.
You will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of reports and dashboards in Power BI, including design, implementation, testing, security level, and data modeling.
You will interact with the stakeholders for detecting and solving issues or needs related to the platform.

What is in it for you?

When you join our team, we offer you a competitive salary and secondary benefits. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work Certification 2021-2022: https://www.fujitsu.com/es/about/great-place/

Your profile

You have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Telecommunications or Computer Engineering, and at least 3 years of experience with Power BI, preferably within the IT and/or consultancy industry and working on projects related to data and data warehouse in Microsoft Technologies, so the Power BI Portal holds no secrets for you, making you familiar with:

Configuration and maintenance of the connection gates (professional and personal) of Microsoft Power BI and administration of licenses, users, and workspaces.
You manage the functionalities of Power BI and the allowed codes, including the use of SQL.
You have experience with the creation of ETL Workflows by Power Query with a graphical interface and M language in Power BI.
You have experience with the application of relations and hierarchies in Power BI for the materialization of detailed models.
You have knowledge of DAX Language and experience in the creation of Power BI measurements, columns, and data transformations.
You know how to model, cleanse, and ensure the quality of data, keeping control of missing data, mistakes, inconsistencies, or inadequacy.
You have participated in the designing of models for analytical data exploitation according to the functional requirements. All of it while following good corporate practices, and adapting to different levels of normalization, preferably in the STAR model without ambiguity or redundancies.
Experience working with agile, Kanban, scrum boards, and project manager.

You were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results. You are a natural team player, eager to learn, and flexible to adapt regardless of the environments you are required to join. Next to this, you are fluent in Spanish and English.

Shape your world and achieve together

We want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.

About Fujitsu

Since being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.

More information: www.fujitsu.com.

And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model.

Job Description

As an Implementation Specialist/Analyst, you will help to deliver Digital asset tracking solutions globally to Brambles customers as the company widens its digital footprint, gathers key learnings, and further develops its tech capability and value proposition for customer solutions.
You will be someone who has analytical and software application background, decent knowledge about industrial and retail supply chain network, and rich experience in working with R&D team on deploying new solutions still in development, and project management from technical implementation perspective. The role would be dedicated to Digital customer solution projects.

Digital Solution Readiness and Scalability ‚Äì Work closely with Digital software/hardware engineering team, product, support and operations team to understand gaps from end to end solution perspective. Customer Engagement & Satisfaction ‚Äì Serve as major interface and liaison with customer users from technical implementation perspective throughout the solution delivery and post mortem session. Work closely with commercial and product team hearing customer feedback in iterative staged development and deployment cycles.

Project Management ‚Äì Manage projects from solution implementation perspective and liaison with engineering and product team on potential workarounds or testing required such as from compliance, legal and security considerations.

Customer Service - On-board user training and support from analytical perspective
User Acceptance Testing ‚Äì Participate in house user acceptance testing to ensure the end to end solution is reliable and repeatable on all user cases.

Zero Harm ‚Äì Ensure all operations are compliance with Zero Harm framework with all Zero Harm policies and action plans are fully implemented.

Experience and Skills

3+ year experience of software solution delivery and implementation
Rich project leadership and project management experience
Business cases/projects managed and executed with customers
Knowledge of industrial supply chain network is strongly preferred
Knowledge in IoT digital solution is strongly preferred
Cross functional experience and effective communication
Working experience in a global and diversed cultural organization
Experience providing data analytics
Understanding of databases structure

Technical Skills: exposure to Python, Excel, Hive SQL, SQL, Pyspark, Reporting tools & Visualization tools. Cloud Platforms: ideally AWS

Personal: energetic, proactive, effective communicator, solution driven, customer focused, independent, self-disciplined, hands-on, analytical, result oriented, relationship builder, team leader, team player, strategic & critical thinker, quick learner, collaborative.

Preferred Education
Bachelors

Preferred Level of Work Experience
3 - 5 years

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to developing a diverse workforce in which everyone is treated fairly, with respect, and has the opportunity to contribute to business success while realizing his or her potential. This means harnessing the unique skills and experience that each individual brings and we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

As Global Reporting and Analytics Analyst you will manage and standardise the global reporting for our plants across all the systems (FDE ‚Äì tablets, ESP, Kiosk, ‚Äòother‚Äô TBD) and across a balanced scorecard.

Acerca del empleo
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions

What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge

Nice to have
Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++‚Ä¶)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Do you want to be part of a leading international company in offering solutions to the hospitality industry?

MAKRO (it is a subsidiary of the METRO Group), whose objective is to bring distribution within the HoReCa sector to its maximum level, taking advantage of the advantages offered by digitalization or the delivery service, always maintaining the focus on the client and success of your business.

We are looking for a BI Analyst (Operations) for the new area of Data & Analytics, whose main mission is to be a part of driving force of business performance and business insights at Makro Spain that can lead to impactful decisions through the data :

RESPONSIBILITIES:

‚Ä¢Support the Operations area in the implementation of a consistent reporting flow (through MicroStrategy) with relevant information for the department's decision-making.

OUR PROPOSAL

- We offer you to be part of a global company, leader in wholesale distribution and that seeks to continuously contribute to the culture and social life of the more than 30 countries in which we are present.

- Our proposal is based on a competitive salary, benefits designed for you and the possibility of opting for our flexible remuneration plan.

- At Makro, you are in charge of your own development. So that your growth has no limits, we offer you a proactive and open training platform.

OUR TEAM

At Makro we are committed to Equal Opportunities for women and men and we are committed to guaranteeing this in the selection processes we carry out.

If you are a positive, enterprising person and want to work with a leading team to build a project for the future and be the partner of the hospitality industry, we are looking for people like YOU!

Acerca del empleo
Something Extraordinary Every Day‚Ñ¢
As our Customer Knowledge and Insights Analyst, you support our membership and Private Client Services programme, by providing data-driven insights to relevant senior executives leading those business units. You will be responsible for commercial modelling of the programmes, KPI forecasting, reporting and deep analytics, all of which will enable key leaders to make informed decisions on strategy and progress against key targets.

We are looking for someone to support us with deep data analytics & guest insights in order for us to create convincing evidence for brands, Villages and growth initiatives. You will also be segmenting the guest database in new ways to inform business decisions and more effective marketing.

You will apply strategic thinking to translate guest insights into defined business opportunities which help drive guest value and loyalty across our Membership and Private Client Services Programmes.

What makes you special
Every colleague is an entrepreneur at heart and this drives our organisational culture, which values invention, innovation and risk taking. To be successful with us as our Customer Knowledge and Insights Analyst you‚Äôll have/be:

Experience in advanced analytics, customer insights, strategy, management consulting, investment banking or equivalent
Working knowledge of SQL, Python, Power BI, Power BI DAX, R statistical software, Excel and Salesforce.
The ability to extract and manipulate data from CRM systems to other tools
Examples of when you‚Äôve structured large analytical problems, simplified and analysed them
Detailed understanding of guest intelligence and impact it has on business strategy
Fluency in English (verbal and written); any other European languages would be advantageous
Highly analytical and detail conscious

There‚Äôs no one quite like us
The Bicester Village Shopping Collection are the worlds‚Äô leading luxury shopping destinations, and we are committed to creating magical and memorable experiences for our guests. Taking the name of the founding Village, The Bicester Village Shopping Collection distinguishes the 11 Villages in Europe and China as one collection of destinations for our guests, our brand partners, our travel and tourism partners, our corporate and financial media, and our internal teams.
Why we‚Äôre exceptional
The key to our success is the quality and commitment of our people. To work in one of the teams at any of the Villages is to play an active role in redefining both the art and the science of retail. This creates a dynamic approach that underpins our ability to anticipate future trends in a fast changing world. In return for your Authenticity, Critical Thinking, Innovation, Passion and Vision, you‚Äôll receive a generous salary and we‚Äôll also reward you by:

Looking after you: You‚Äôre entitled to 25 days of annual leave (plus UK Bank Holidays) and your birthday off, plus extra leave if you are getting married or moving. We provide above industry average life assurance cover, income protection, pension, personal travel insurance, dental and eyecare, private healthcare, access to a virtual GP app, Employee Assistance Programme, cycle to work scheme and flu vaccinations

Treating you: discounts throughout our villages, discounts with other retailers (known as My Choices) and a very generous employee referral bonus

Championing you: you‚Äôll be working within a creative and collaborative environment like no other, with the opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills while advancing your career.

Come and live your story with us
The Bicester Village Shopping Collection is made up of 1,200 colleagues of 50 nationalities. We are diverse in background, age, experience and leadership style. We believe that an inclusive workforce makes magic happen, and with this in mind we welcome everyone - regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability or ethnicity - to be a part of our family.
